definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)

sentences.english: There is a florist right in the hotel lobby. All I have to do is call on the house phone.
sentences.chinese: 飯店大廳就有一個花商，我只要撥個內線電話就行了。

sentences.english: Mother's Day is probably one of the most lucrative times of the year for florists.
sentences.chinese: 母親節很可能是花商一年中最爲盈利的日子。

sentences.english: The dissatisfied customer berated the florist.
sentences.chinese: 不滿意的顧客責罵花商。

sentences.english: Blair : I prefer to get my own peonies from my own florist but thank you so much.
sentences.chinese: 我還是想從我的花商那兒買牡丹，但仍然十分感謝你。

sentences.english: Florists and Pastry Cooks make thousands of dollars on that day!
sentences.chinese: 在那天，花商和餡餅廚師收入頗豐。

sentences.english: The florist's son handed her a gift.
sentences.chinese: 花商的兒子遞給她一份禮物。
